items.q: Which of these famous actors was NOT part of the 'Brat Pack' in 1980s cinema?
items.explanation: Cruise was a rising 80s star, but was never considered a core member of the Brat Pack.

items.q: The first feature-length animated movie released by Disney was 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs'.
items.explanation: Released in 1937, it was a massive critical and commercial success.

items.q: In filmmaking, 'foley' refers to the process of adding computer-generated visual effects.
items.explanation: Foley is the reproduction of everyday sound effects added to films in post-production.

items.q: What legendary rock band was famously fronted by Freddie Mercury?
items.explanation: They wrote classic anthems like 'Bohemian Rhapsody' and 'We Will Rock You'.

items.q: What acclaimed 2008 film directed by Christopher Nolan famously features Heath Ledger as the Joker?
items.explanation: It redefined the superhero movie genre and earned Ledger a posthumous Oscar.

items.q: What heavily influential synthesizer was incredibly popular in 1980s pop music, known for its distinct digital sound?
items.explanation: It was one of the best-selling synthesizers of all time and defined the era's sound.

items.q: In the music business, what is an 'A&R' representative responsible for?
items.a: Artists and Repertoire (scouting and developing talent).
items.explanation: They are the link between the artist and the record label.

items.q: Which iconic television show was created by Matt Groening and James L. Brooks?
items.explanation: It debuted in 1989 and is the longest-running American animated series.

items.q: What critically acclaimed sci-fi franchise features the USS Enterprise exploring the galaxy?
items.explanation: The original series spawned a massive, enduring entertainment franchise.

items.q: Which celebrated film director is known for his gory, stylized violence in movies like 'Kill Bill' and 'Reservoir Dogs'?
items.explanation: His unique style pays homage to classic exploitation films and spaghetti westerns.
